## Introduction

This presentation will show you examples of statistical processes in archaeology and how these processes can be automated with computer scripts

## Historiography of Archaeology

| Start     | Period | Description |
|:----------|:-------|:------------|
| 1850      | 1<sup>st</sup> revolution in archaeology  | theory of evolution, geology, early anthropology |
| 1950      | Culture-Historical  | typology (similarities), chronology, 14C |
| 1960      | Processual archaeology  | chain operative, positivism |
| 1980      | Post-processual archaeology  | differences / similarities, cultural relativism |
| 2020      | Tool-driven archaeology  | Big data, modelling, aDNA |

: Historiography of Archaeology
